sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Find the derivative of f(x) = 5x^7 using the power rule.
message_2:
The power rule states that if f(x) = x^n, then the derivative f'(x) = nx^(n-1). 

In this case, f(x) = 5x^7, so n = 7. Applying the power rule, we get:

f'(x) = 7 * 5x^(7-1) = 35x^6
